page.title: 01 GAZETEER.
page.content: About 85% of this area is sea, sand and dunes.Of the rest,most is taken up by the Royal Birkdale Golf Club which hosted the Open Golf Championships in 1983.The remaining is a residential area which contains the southern limit of Victorian growth in Southport and also some recent development.All the houses are large villas typical of the most prosperous properties in Southport.The sand dunes are part of one of the most important wildlife habitats in the British Isles protecting such species as the Natterjack Toad while to bird watchers the beach and mudflats are part of one of the most interesting stretches of coastline in the whole of Europe. The beach is also used by Shrimpers at work,many people at leisure and by Ginger McCain to exerise his race horses including the famous Red Rum.
